definitions.definition: to express your choice or opinion, especially by officially writing a mark on a paper or by raising your hand or speaking in a meeting:
examples: She was too young to vote in the election.

definitions.definition: the act of showing your choice or opinion in an election or meeting by writing an X on an official piece of paper or putting your hand up:
examples: The suggestion was approved, with 25 votes in favour, and seven against.

definitions.definition: a way of making a decision by asking a group of people to vote:
examples: We called a meeting in order to take/hold a vote on the issue.

definitions.definition: the total number of votes given or received in an election:
examples: The party got/took 25 percent of the vote.

definitions.definition: the fact of being officially allowed to vote:
examples: In some countries women still don't have the vote.
The proposal was read out and then put to the vote.
